io.netty.handler.codec.http.multipart

Enum HttpPostRequestEncoder.EncoderMode

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<HttpPostRequestEncoder.EncoderMode>
      • io.netty.handler.codec.http.multipart.HttpPostRequestEncoder.EncoderMode
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<HttpPostRequestEncoder.EncoderMode>
    Enclosing class:
    HttpPostRequestEncoder

    public static enum HttpPostRequestEncoder.EncoderMode
extends java.lang.Enum<HttpPostRequestEncoder.EncoderMode>
    Different modes to use to encode form data.

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      HTML5
      The HTML5 spec disallows mixed mode in multipart/form-data requests.
      RFC1738
      Legacy mode which should work for most.
      RFC3986
      Mode which is more new and is used for OAUTH

    • Method Summary

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        getClass, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Enum Constant Detail

      • RFC1738

        public static final HttpPostRequestEncoder.EncoderMode RFC1738
        Legacy mode which should work for most. It is known to not work with OAUTH. For OAUTH use RFC3986. The W3C form recommendations this for submitting post form data.

      • RFC3986

        public static final HttpPostRequestEncoder.EncoderMode RFC3986
        Mode which is more new and is used for OAUTH

      • HTML5

        public static final HttpPostRequestEncoder.EncoderMode HTML5
        The HTML5 spec disallows mixed mode in multipart/form-data requests. More concretely this means that more files submitted under the same name will not be encoded using mixed mode, but will be treated as distinct fields. Reference: http://www.w3.org/TR/html5/forms.html#multipart-form-data

    • Method Detail

        public static HttpPostRequestEncoder.EncoderMode[] values()
        Returns an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared. This method may be used to iterate over the constants as follows: 
        for (HttpPostRequestEncoder.EncoderMode c : HttpPostRequestEncoder.EncoderMode.values())
    System.out.println(c);
        Returns:
        an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared
